001package Calibration_Plugins_2;
002
003import ij.IJ;
004import ij.ImagePlus;
005import ij.ImageStack;
006import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
007import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
008import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
009import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.Camera;
010import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.ViewTransform;
011import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.data.CalibrationImage;
012import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.data.ZhangData;
013import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.util.MathUtil;
014import imagingbook.common.color.sets.BasicAwtColor;
015import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ColoredStroke;
016import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ShapeOverlayAdapter;
017import imagingbook.core.resource.ImageResource;
018import org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Rotation;
019
020import java.awt.Shape;
021import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
022import java.awt.geom.Point2D;
023import java.util.ArrayList;
024import java.util.List;
025
026import static imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils.splitLines;
027
028/**
029 * This plugin performs interpolation of views, given a sequence of key views. Translations (3D camera positions) are
030 * interpolated linearly. Pairs of rotations are interpolated by linear mixture of the corresponding quaternion
031 * representations (see
032 * http://www.opengl-tutorial.org/intermediate-tutorials/tutorial-17-quaternions/#How_do_I_interpolate_between_2_quaternions__).
033 *
034 * @author WB
035 * @version 2022/12/19
036 */
037public class View_Interpolation_Demo implements PlugIn {
038
039        private static ImageResource resource = CalibrationImage.CalibImageStack;
040        private static int NumberOfInterpolatedFrames = 10;
041        private static double PeakHeightZ = -1.5;
042        private static BasicAwtColor BackGroundColor = BasicAwtColor.White;
043        private static BasicAwtColor LineColor = BasicAwtColor.Black;
044        private static double LineWidth = 1.0;
045
046
047        public void run(String arg0) {
048                ImagePlus testIm = resource.getImagePlus();
049                if (testIm == null) {
050                        IJ.error("Could not open calibration images!"); 
051                        return;
052                }
053
054                if (!runDialog()) {
055                        return;
056                }
057
058                Camera cam = ZhangData.getCameraIntrinsics();
059                Point2D[] modelPoints = ZhangData.getModelPoints();
060
061                final int w = testIm.getWidth();
062                final int h = testIm.getHeight();
063                final int M = testIm.getNSlices();
064
065                ImageStack animStack = new ImageStack(w, h);
066                ByteProcessor bgIp = new ByteProcessor(w, h);   // background image for all stack slices
067                bgIp.setColor(BackGroundColor.getColor());
068                bgIp.fill();
069
070                ShapeOverlayAdapter ola = new ShapeOverlayAdapter();
071                ola.setStroke(new ColoredStroke(LineWidth, LineColor.getColor()));
072
073                int sliceNo = 1;
074                for (int A = 0; A < M; A++) {
075                        int B = (A + 1) % M;
076                        ViewTransform viewA = ZhangData.getViewTransform(A);    // view A
077                        ViewTransform viewB = ZhangData.getViewTransform(B);    // view B
078
079                        Rotation rA = viewA.getRotation();
080                        Rotation rB = viewB.getRotation();
081                        double[] tA = viewA.getTranslation();
082                        double[] tB = viewB.getTranslation();
083
084                        // interpolation step k for view pair (A,B)
085                        for (int k = 0; k < NumberOfInterpolatedFrames; k++) {
086                                double alpha = (double) k / NumberOfInterpolatedFrames;
087                                Rotation rk = MathUtil.Lerp(rA, rB, alpha);     // interpolate rotation
088                                double[] tk = MathUtil.Lerp(tA, tB, alpha);     // interpolate translation
089                                ViewTransform viewK = new ViewTransform(rk, tk);
090
091                                String sliceLabel = String.format("frame-%d-%d", A, k);
092                                animStack.addSlice(sliceLabel, bgIp);   // dummy image with white background
093                                ola.setStackPosition(sliceNo++);
094                                for (Shape s : makePyramids(cam, viewK, modelPoints)) {
095                                        ola.addShape(s);
096                                }
097                        }
098                }
099                ImagePlus animIm = new ImagePlus("Animation", animStack);
100                animIm.setOverlay(ola.getOverlay());
101                animIm.show();
102        }
103
104        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
105
106        List<Shape> makePyramids(Camera cam, ViewTransform view, Point2D[] modelPoints) {
107                List<Shape> shapes = new ArrayList<>();
108                for (int i = 0; i < modelPoints.length; i += 4) {
109                        Point2D[] modelSq = new Point2D[4];
110                        Point2D[] imageSq = new Point2D[4];
111                        // 3D points p0,...,p3 define a model square in the Z=0 plane
112                        for (int j = 0; j < 4; j++) {
113                                modelSq[j] = modelPoints[i + j];
114                                imageSq[j] = MathUtil.toPoint2D(cam.project(view, modelSq[j]));
115                        }
116                        // make the 3D pyramid peak and project to 2D:
117                        double[] modelPeak3d = new double[3];
118                        modelPeak3d[0] = (modelSq[0].getX() + modelSq[2].getX()) / 2;   // X
119                        modelPeak3d[1] = (modelSq[0].getY() + modelSq[2].getY()) / 2;   // Y
120                        modelPeak3d[2] = PeakHeightZ;   // Z
121                        Point2D pk = MathUtil.toPoint2D(cam.project(view, modelPeak3d));
122                        // make and add the projected pyramid for this model quad:
123                        shapes.add(makePyramidShape(imageSq, pk));
124                }
125                return shapes;
126        }
127
128        private Shape makePyramidShape(Point2D[] pnts, Point2D pk) {    // takes 4 base points + 1 peak point
129                Path2D path = new Path2D.Double();
130                // draw the base quad:
131                path.moveTo(pnts[0].getX(), pnts[0].getY());
132                for (int j = 1; j < 4; j++) {
133                        path.lineTo(pnts[j].getX(), pnts[j].getY());
134                }
135                path.closePath();
136                // draw lines to pyramid peak
137                for (int j = 0; j < 4; j++) {
138                        path.moveTo(pnts[j].getX(), pnts[j].getY());
139                        path.lineTo(pk.getX(), pk.getY());
140                }
141                return path;
142        }
143
144        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
145
146        private boolean runDialog() {
147                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
148                gd.setInsets(0, 0, 0);
149                gd.addMessage(splitLines(40,
150                                "This plugin performs interpolation of views, given a sequence of key views."));
151
152                gd.addNumericField("Number of interpolated frames", NumberOfInterpolatedFrames);
153                gd.addNumericField("Pyramid peak height (inches)", PeakHeightZ);
154
155                gd.showDialog();
156                if (gd.wasCanceled())
157                        return false;
158
159                NumberOfInterpolatedFrames = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
160                PeakHeightZ = gd.getNextNumber();
161                return true;
162        }
163
164}
